Reviews.Content: Not even half as good as seen on the website The stay in Hostal d'Uxelles was very disappoiting. First we didn't even find the location because there was no seperate entry. The Hostal is situated in a normal building what makes it hard to find it. In fact, it is only a large apartment that has been transformed into a hotel. Our room was small and dim and the washroom apparently had simply been integrated in it. The walls were very thin, the beds weren't comfortable at all and the breakfast that was supposed to be available didn't exist. Besides only one person could have a warm shower because the water gets cold very quickly. After all I can't recommend to stay in this location. To much money for what you get...
Reviews.Author: tricia23

Reviews.Content: awful - certainly not value for money this hotel was not good value. Our first room was no larger than a big cupboard with many broken fixtures. The reception was very pleasant but the accommodation not up to any kind of standard. We reserved this hotel through Fairview Madrid, who charged us 鈧?25 per night; the hotel charge was 鈧?5 per night plus 7% local tax had we booked directly.

Reviews.Content: Delightful       bedroom
Reviews.Author: MairiM

Reviews.Content: Hotel Dux-Hell Ignore the website pictures, they are pure deception. This place was a disaster from first to last. Hairs in the lumpy beds from previous people - slept on top of bedding (luckily it was boiling hot). Bathroom looked like someone had taken a sledge hammer to it - full of holes in ceiling, bath panel and behind loo (very frightening experience for our 4 yr old child to use). Staff pretended not to understand English OR French for the lights are broken in order to evade fixing our bedside and balcony lights. The balcony chairs were rusty and crumbling. The room was absolutely filthy - we lived out of our cases rather than use the wardrobe which was covered in a layer of grit and dust (as was the floor and the chairs. Our main problem though was the staff - as soon as they had our cash, they were ignorant, rude, and hostile. Our daughter tried in three languages to get a 'hello' out of the staff as she passed reception and was blanked on every ocassion. We left this place nervous wrecks, tired as hell and angry.
Reviews.Author: bluetortoise

Reviews.Content: Sweatbox to the power 10!! I too had the misfortune to stay in this autoclave. It was that hot that my sweat was sweating. On hindsight I would rather have shared a room [-----------------] while wee Jimmy Crankie stuck shards of glass underneath my toenails while shouting fandabbydozi at the top of his/her voice.In conclusion - don't go!
Reviews.Author: The_Hawkmeister

Reviews.Content: sweatbox! cramped, offensively warm sweatbox with broken shutters and a bathroom ceiling constructed from plastic sheeting and staples.I honestly would rather spend a night in a 3 man Alcatraz prison cell with big Bubba and Leroy than stay in this flea pit again
Reviews.Author: condorr

Reviews.Content: Basic, noisy but generally OK We stayed in room 109 which is over the side street, just round the corner from the Grand Via. The traffic noise is considerable, even at night, and then there are those bin lorries! However, I used ear plugs and slept like a baby. Keeping the window shut and the fan on (completely silent running fan) kept the temperature satisfactory. The room was basic but perfectly comfortable with a tiled floor. The beds were excellent and the room and bathroom were kept clean. The bathroom was tiny but was OK for a short stay. Unfortunately our loo overflowed on the last morning we were there. We just left, so I don't know how long it took to sort it out. Breakfast was cold toast, cheese, ham, croissant and small cake with black tea or coffee served in the room. The staff were friendly except for one lady who viewed the guests as a nuisance.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: My worst travel experience Together with a friend I have just spent three nights in the noisiest, uncomfortable room I have experienced in 40+ years of travelling. We were put in the annex which is on an extremely busy corner of a main road. Traffic noise is such that we were unable to open windows and the air conditioning fan was so noisy that this could not be tolerated for long periods. The rooms are also potitioned just above street level overlooking vast refuse bins which are regularly serviced, very noisily, at about 2.30 a.m.The main hotel seems to be in a quieter positiion and I would recommend anyone not to accept accommodation in the annex.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly reception The lady in the reception was everything else than helpful. The room was nice but very noisy -- a big boulevard outside (nothing to do about that), a telephone box (nothing to do about that either) and two big containers for empty bottles and other garbage. Apart from that, the central heating was broken, so we couldn't turn the heat down - it was very hot!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Too noisy, and a horrible bed We asked for a silent room, so we got room 205 in across the street from the receiption. It was on the second floor and not very silent: for example, you could hear the traffic and also the noise form the people coming out of the bar in same building. However, the worst noise seemed to come from the water pipes, I guess it was due to someone else in the hostal or building having a shower (early in the morning).The bed was horrible. It was very short (I am 1,91 tall) so my feet stuck out, although I am used to that when staying in Spanish hostels. However, the worst thing was that the bed was very soft, so it was difficult to find a good sleeping position. And the bed made a lot of noise when you tried to change your position. As I tried it a lot of times, the bed made a lot of noise and my wife got angry with me.I also found that the general standard was very low for a room costing more than EUR 95 for one night (double room, high season rate) (although I have the feeling that Barcelona is generally expensive when it comes to lodging). In any case, I will definitely not stay at this hostal again and I will not recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: EpaMadrid

Reviews.Content: Not bad at all The location was great - a 15 minute walk from the Segrada Familia and about 10 from the Placa de Cataluyna/ Las Ramblas. I did expect the room to be a bit bigger from the pictures I've seen on their website, but I suppose one could call it cozy. I didnt experience any problem with noise as mentioned in previous reviews - I took the advice of a newspaper article and asked for a room at the back of the main building (i.e. away from the traffic down the Grand Via) with a terrace. Overall, it was quite good.
Reviews.Author: SergioLondon

Reviews.Content: Loved it. I was very impressed with the hotel and had a great stay. The location is perfect - 10 minutes walk from the centre and 5 from a metro stop. The room was brilliant, not swanky, but really nicely done. Had our own terrace and everything. Would definitely reccomend it.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not impressed We stayed here following the glowing reviews that appeared in the Telegraph on several occasions. We are fairly self sufficient and were not expecting luxury but did think there would be some charm to the place. On arriving on the airport bus at Placa Catalunya we walked the 10 minutes or so to the hotel. It was very quiet as the Grand Prix was on and it was a Sunday morning. Getting robbed by two men posing as police who suspected that the 'italian tourist' who approached us was a drug dealer, was a real upset. On checking our money after they had been through it we found 150euros missing. On arriving at the hotel, it was difficult to find as it was upstairs in a block. Reception were efficient enough but not very friendly and throughout our stay, most staff barely managed an 'ola'. When we asked about a police station to report our loss on arrival, shoulders were shrugged and we had to go to Tourist Information. Our room was very basic with the minute TV 8 feet in the air. We don't watch much TV so weren't too bothered but if you do like to watch, take a pair of binoculars. The room was very plain with a tiny bathroom and even tinier bath, although it did have quite a bit of character. However, on my having a bath that evening we found there was no hot water at all for a second bath/shower for my husband. Reception were totally unconcerned and said it would be fixed 'maybe tomorrow, maybe not'. They seemed to think it strange that we were even bothering to tell them about it. Water did actually run hot later that night, so it was ok in the end but the attitude rankled a bit. Traffic noise, funnily enough, was not a great problem although it is a very busy road traffic wise. We stayed six nights and generally it was ok but might be a problem for light sleepers. The road is quiet at night in terms of pedestrians about and this worried us given our encounter on arrival. The location was ok but not the best. For 75 euros plus tax per night, we think there must be better places to stay with more character and friendlier staff. A colleague recently stayed at the Jardi and said that was really nice. All in all, find somewhere else and look after your money. We are very careful always about pickpockets and bagsnatchers but when faced with two burly men on a quiet street, you don't feel able to object in case you are physically attacked. The telegraph is usually quite reliable for reviews (the Brouwer in Amsterdam was great) but we will be wary of them in the future.
Reviews.Author: Ostrich

Reviews.Content: Above average 2 star hotel We spent 3 nights at the Hostal D'Uxelles from 14-17th March 2004. It is an apartment hotel, situated on the 2nd floor of a residential/office block. Excellent location on Gran Via Cort Catalanes, if a little noisy due to traffic late at night. 10 mins easy walk from the main Placa Catalunya/Ramblas area. Reception staff were pleasant and efficient. Our en-suite room was small, but prettily decorated. Spotlessly clean, with a comfortable bed and a balcony overlooking the street. We found it ideal for a short stay and very good value for money at ?53 per room, per night. Breakfast not included in price, but there is a good Cafe Bar just across the street, where you can get coffee  croissants, etc, whilst soaking up the local atmosphere. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: winem0nster

Reviews.Content: Lovely I stay five or six times in the hostal d'Uxelles ( two or three in the main building and two or three times in the annex). For me, both hotels are comfortables. The hotels are located in the center of Barcelona, very good for us, and is normal have a little noisy because is a big center with a lot of people travel all the day, but is bearable. In my opinion the hotels have the same decoration. The bathrooms are very originals and the rooms has in his walls decorations style Gaudi. The beds are ok ( corrects). The only difference that i can see in the annex is that there isn't reception but you have the same comodity of the main building. I suggest it.
Reviews.Author: audreyUnitedKingdom

Reviews.Content: Very disappointing We stayed at the annex, which is on the other side of the road. It was difficult to find, as the hotel name was not on the door. The room was tiny, the bed was uncomfortable, there was a strange smell in the room and there was a lot of noise from the main road and other guests. We chose this hotel because of its good review from the Daily Telegraph. Maybe the main part of the hotel is better. We would not go there again. We would choose a hotel in the old part of town next time.
